Comments.Charlie Sides: I have posted this before but I am seeing a lot of comments being added to this idea lately so I thought it might be worth posting again.  We are a med device company with multiple divisions all selling into the same hospitals so we have the multiple owners scenario that several of you have mentioned below.  The solution we found is to use Territory Management, which is available to all of you for no extra charge.  You just need to enable it and set it up.   All of our Accounts are owned by a generic admin user and we don't even have the Owner field on the Account Page layout.  The Territory Management related list shows who all "owns" the account record and what their role is.   Reports and List Views can both be run for "My Territory's Accounts" or "My Territory Team's Accounts".    In our case we have a field for each division on the Account object that defines the Territory assignment and then the lowest level hierarchy rules use those fields to determine who "owns" what.  Then everyone above them in the Territory Mangement hierarchy inherits visibility to the Accounts of the users below them (this is independent of the role and forecast hierarchies).  You can assign more than one user to a territory as well as assign one Account to multiple territories.  This is so much better than trying to use Account Teams.  There is plenty of documentation online for how to set this up.
